page.title: 17OUR LOCAL POLICEMAN
page.content: P.C. Johnson is our local policeman. He came to school to talk about his job. This is what P.C. Johnson's day is like. He does a day shift. He starts at 8am. He spends half an hour looking at his paperwork and dealing with enquires. At 8:30 he goes to peoples' houses and follows up the enquires. The type of laws broken in the Shardlow area are things like speeding or a broken window or parking on double yellow lines or in front of peoples' drives. There are sometimes break-ins on the boats in the marina. When there are no things to do he just rides around on his bike and keeps a check on the area. He ends his day at 4pm. The type of crimes we get are very different from the crimes in a city. In a city there are more violent crimes and theft.
